alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Cimarron; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 31 at 5:12AM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...MORE SNOW HEADED FOR THE PANHANDLES... An upper level storm system is expected to track south through the Great Basin on Tuesday and through southern New Mexico and West Texas on Thursday. An arctic cold front will move south across the Panhandles Wednesday morning. Moisture will increase across the area to help produce widespread snowfall across the Panhandles late Tuesday night through Thursday. Accumulating snowfall of 2 to 5 inches will be possible across much of the Panhandles by the time the snow comes to an end Thursday afternoon. Snow is expected to develop over the Oklahoma Panhandle late Tuesday night and then it is expected to spread southward across the rest of the area by Wednesday morning. Snow will continue off and on Wednesday through Thursday morning before ending from west to east Thursday afternoon. Falling snow, low visibilities, and slick roadways may affect the commutes Wednesday morning, Wednesday evening, and again Thursday morning. North winds of 15 to 25 mph may cause areas of blowing and drifting snow Wednesday and Wednesday night. Wind chill readings are expected to be in the -5 to -15 degree range on Thursday morning and again on Friday morning. Stay tuned to the developments of this winter system by visiting our homepage at www.weather.gov/ama/ or on Facebook and Twitter.
